register.description:
Description.
This register identifies the peripheral and its exact version.

bitfield.description: Module identifier used to uniquely identify this IP.

Standard IP MMR block offset. Standard IP MMRs are the set of from aggregated IRQ registers till DTB.
0: Standard IP MMRs do not exist
0x1-0xF: Standard IP MMRs begin at offset of (64*STDIPOFF from the base IP address)
IP Instance ID number. If multiple instances of IP exists in SOC, this field can identify the instance number 0-15
Major revision of IP 0-15
Minor revision of IP 0-15.

register.description:
Interrupt mask.
This register selects interrupt sources which are allowed to pass from RIS to MIS when the corresponding bit-fields are set to 1.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Systimer counter overflow event interrupt mask.
Systimer channel 4 event interrupt mask.
Systimer channel 3 event interrupt mask.
Systimer channel 2 event interrupt mask.
Systimer channel 1 event interrupt mask.
Systimer channel 0 event interrupt mask.

register.description:
Raw interrupt status.
This register reflects the state of all pending interrupts, regardless of masking. This register allows the user to implement a poll scheme. A flag set in this register can be cleared by writing 1 to the corresponding ICLR register bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Raw interrupt status for Systimer counter overflow event. This bit is set to 1 when an event is received on SysTimer Overflow occurs.
Raw interrupt status for channel 4 event. This bit is set to 1 when a CAPTURE or COMPARE event is received on channel 4.
Raw interrupt status for channel 3 event. This bit is set to 1 when a CAPTURE or COMPARE event is received on channel 3.
Raw interrupt status for channel 2 Event. This bit is set to 1 when a CAPTURE or COMPARE event is received on channel 2.
Raw interrupt status for channel 1 event. This bit is set to 1 when a CAPTURE or COMPARE event is received on channel 1.
Raw interrupt status for channel 0 event. This bit is set to 1 when a CAPTURE or COMPARE event is received on channel 0.

register.description:
Masked interrupt status.
This register is simply a bitwise AND of the contents of IMASK and RIS.*] registers. A flag set in this register can be cleared by writing 1 to the corresponding ICLR register bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Mask Interrupt status for Systimer counter overflow Event in MIS register.
Mask interrupt status for channel 4 event.
Mask interrupt status for channel 3 event.
Mask interrupt status for channel 2 event.
Mask interrupt status for channel 1 event.
Mask interrupt status for channel 0 event.

register.description:
Interrupt set.
This register can used by software for diagnostics and safety checking purposes. Writing a 1 to a bit in this register will set the event and the corresponding RIS bit also gets set. If the corresponding IMASK bit is set, then the corresponding MIS register bit also gets set.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Sets Systimer counter overflow interrupt.
Sets channel 4 interrupt.
Sets channel 3 interrupt.
Sets channel 2 interrupt.
Sets channel 1 interrupt.
Sets channel 0 interrupt.

register.description:
Interrupt clear.
'This register allows software to clear interrupts. Writing a 1 to a bit in this register will clear the event and the corresponding RIS bit also gets cleared. If the corresponding IMASK bit is set, then the corresponding MIS register bit also gets cleared.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Clears Systimer counter overflow interrupt.
Clears channel 4 interrupt.
Clears channel 3 interrupt.
Clears channel 2 interrupt.
Clears channel 1 interrupt.
Clears channel 0 interrupt.

register.description:
Interrupt mask set.
Writing a 1 to a bit in this register will set the corresponding IMASK bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Sets Timer Overflow Event Interrupt Mask.
Sets channel4 Event Interrupt mask
Sets channel3 Event Interrupt mask
Sets channel2 Event Interrupt mask
Sets channel1 Event Interrupt mask
Sets channel0 Event Interrupt mask

register.description:
Interrupt mask clear.
Writing a 1 to a bit in this register will clear the corresponding IMASK bit.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Clears Timer Overflow Event Interrupt Mask.
Clears channel4 Event Interrupt Mask.
Clears channel3 Event Interrupt Mask.
Clears channel2 Event Interrupt Mask.
Clears channel1 Event Interrupt Mask.
Clears channel0 Event Interrupt Mask.

register.description:
Emulation control.
This register controls the behavior of the IP related to core halted input.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Halt control.

bitenum.token: Freeze option. The IP freezes functionality when the core halted input is asserted, and resumes when it is deasserted. The freeze can either be immediate or after the IP has reached a boundary from where it can resume without corruption.
bitenum.description: Freeze option. The IP freezes functionality when the core halted input is asserted, and resumes when it is deasserted. The freeze can either be immediate or after the IP has reached a boundary from where it can resume without corruption.

bitenum.token: Free run option. The IP ignores the state of the core halted input.
bitenum.description: Free run option. The IP ignores the state of the core halted input.

register.description:
Systimer Counter Value - 250ns resolution.
This 32-bit value reads out bits [31:0] of the systimer counter. The counter is 34-bit and runs on CLKSVT/12. It maintains a resolution of 250ns with a range of about 17.9m.

bitfield.description: 32-bit counter value [31:0]. This will provide a 250ns resolution and a range of 17.9m.

register.description:
Systimer Counter Value - 1μs resolution
This 32-bit value reads out bits[33:2] of the systimer counter. The counter is 34-bit and runs on CLKSVT/12. It maintains a resolution of 1us with a range of about 1 h 11m.

bitfield.description: 32-bit counter value [33:2]. This will provide a resolution of 1us and a range of 1hr and 11m.

register.description: Systimer's channel Output Event Values

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Output Value of channel 4.
Output Value of channel 3.
Output Value of channel 2.
Output Value of channel 1.
Output Value of channel 0.

register.description:
Systimer channel 0 configuration.
This channel has configurability for 250ns and 1us based capture and compare operations.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This bit decides the RESOLUTION of the channel that will be used.
When Rearm is enabled the channel remains in continous capture mode. Otherwise it'll be in one shot capture mode. Rearm is only valid for capture mode.
Decides the channel input signal's mode. Setting the Value as 2'b11 selects the Rise Function.
Decides the channel mode.

register.description:
Systimer channel 1 configuration.
This channel works in 1us based capture and compare operations.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
When Rearm is enabled the channel remains in continous capture mode. Otherwise it'll be in one shot capture mode. Rearm is only valid for capture mode.
Decides the channel input signal's mode. Setting the Value as 2'b11 selects the Rise Function
Decides the channel mode.

register.description:
Systimer channel 2 configuration.
This channel works in 250ns based capture and compare operations.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
When Rearm is enabled the channel remains in continous capture mode. Otherwise it'll be in one shot capture mode. Rearm is only valid for capture mode.
Decides the channel input signal's mode. Setting the Value as 2'b11 selects the Rise Function
Decides the channel mode.

register.description:
Systimer channel 3 configuration.
This channel works in 250ns based capture and compare operations.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
When Rearm is enabled the channel remains in continous capture mode. Otherwise it'll be in one shot capture mode. Rearm is only valid for capture mode.
Decides the channel input signal's mode. Setting the Value as 2'b11 selects the Rise Function
Decides the channel mode.

register.description:
Systimer channel 4 configuration.
This channel works in 250ns based capture and compare operations.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
When Rearm is enabled the channel remains in continous capture mode. Otherwise it'll be in one shot capture mode. Rearm is only valid for capture mode.
Decides the channel input signal's mode. Setting the Value as 2'b11 selects the Rise Function
Decides the channel mode.

register.description:
System Timer channel 0 Capture/Compare register.
This register when written with any compare value will arm the channel to work in compare mode.

bitfield.description: Capture/compare value

register.description:
Systimer's Time bit.
This Register will be used to specify which TIME bit is required by LGPT to be forwarded from SYSTIMER.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
The corresponding bit will have value '1' rest should be '0'. If more than one bit is asserted, output is "or" of all the bits.

bitenum.token: Bit17 is forwarded to the event fabric.

register.description:
Systimer status.
This register can be used to read the running status of the timer and to resync the Systimer with RTC.

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.

This bit indicates sync status of Systimer with RTC. The bitfield has a reset value of '1', which gets cleared to '0' after the Systimer synchronizes with RTC on the first LFTICK edge. A write to this bit resynchronizes the Systimer with RTC on the next LFTICK edge. A read value of '1' indicates the synchronization is ongoing and a read of '0' indicates the synchronization is done.
Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
This bit indicates if the system time is initialized and running.

register.description:
ARMSET
Reading this register gives out the status of the 5 channels. Channel state UNARMED returns 0. Channel state CAPTURE or COMPARE returns 1. A write to ARMSET has for each channel the following effect - If ARMSTA[x]==0 -$gt; no effect If ARMSTA[x]==1 and channel x is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel Else, set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CHxVAL value

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Arming channel 4 for either compare or capture operation.

bitenum.token: if channel 4 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH4CC.VAL value.
bitenum.description: if channel 4 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH4CC.VAL value.

bitfield.description: Arming channel 3 for either compare or capture operation.

bitenum.token: if channel 3 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH3CC.VAL value
bitenum.description: if channel 3 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH3CC.VAL value

bitfield.description: Arming channel 2 for either compare or capture operation.

bitenum.token: if channel 2 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH2CC.VAL value
bitenum.description: if channel 2 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH2CC.VAL value

bitfield.description: Arming channel 1 for either compare or capture operation.

bitenum.token: if channel 1 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can Set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH1CC.VAL value
bitenum.description: if channel 1 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can Set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH1CC.VAL value

bitfield.description: Arming channel 0 for either compare or capture operation.

bitenum.token: if channel 0 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH0CC.VAL value
bitenum.description: if channel 0 is in CAPTURE state then no effect on the channel else it can set channel in COMPARE mode using existing CH0CC.VAL value

register.description:
ARMCLR
Read of this register gives out the status of the 5 channels . Channel state UNARMED returns 0. Channel state CAPTURE or COMPARE returns 1. A write to ARMCLR has for each channel the following effect - If ARMCLR[x]==0 -$gt; no effect. Else, set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle

bitfield.description: Software should not rely on the value of a reserved. Writing any other value than the reset value may result in undefined behavior.
Disarming channel 4

bitenum.token: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle
bitenum.description: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle

bitfield.description: Disarming channel 3

bitenum.token: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle
bitenum.description: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle

bitfield.description: Disarming channel 2

bitenum.token: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle
bitenum.description: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle

bitfield.description: Disarming channel 1

bitenum.token: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle
bitenum.description: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle

bitfield.description: Disarming channel 0

bitenum.token: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle
bitenum.description: Set channel in UNARMED state without triggering event unless a compare/capture event happens in the same cycle

register.description:
Save/restore alias register for channel 0.
A read to this register behaves exactly as a read to CH0CC. Write to CH0CCSR sets CH0CC.VAL value of register without affecting channel state or configuration

bitfield.description: Capture/compare value

register.description:
Save/restore alias registers channel 1.
A read to CH1CCSR behaves exactly as a read to CH1VAL. Write to this register sets CH1CC.VAL without affecting channel state or configuration.

bitfield.description: Capture/compare value

register.description:
Save/restore alias registers channel 2.
A read to CH2CCSR behaves exactly as a read to CH2CC Write to CH2CCSR sets CH2CC.VAL value of register without affecting channel state or configuration
